chapters.summary: Stork continuously tracks your baby's health data like pulse rate, oxygen saturation, and skin temperature. Stork's camera has a QHD capable high resolution video. While Stork isn't a medical advice, it can help you get to know your baby better.
chapters.gist: Stork: The New Smart Home Baby Monitor
chapters.headline: Stork is the new Smart home baby monitoring system

chapters.summary: There just weren't a lot of middle sized rental buildings in Toronto. The main culprit for this is early 20th century zoning laws. Cities with lots of middle housing just have more choice. Cities without middle housing tend to be harder for pretty much everyone except for the wealthy.
chapters.headline: Toronto has a pronounced lack of mid sized apartment buildings

chapters.summary: Alfred Hawes built Spadina Gardens without a permit in Toronto before the city banned these types of buildings. The building is still there, and it's now the oldest in use apartment building in the city. Toronto could have had similar buildings across the city if it weren't for exclusionary zoning.
chapters.headline: Alfred Hawes built a low rise apartment in Toronto before anti-apartment ban

chapters.summary: Most of the new residences being built are luxury. They don't reflect the diversity that is currently needed in the city. There are developers who want to build middle housing, but in most places, it's still illegal to build anything except for single family homes. Jason Allen John wants to build affordable housing in communities he cares about.
chapters.gist: Toronto's missing middle of affordable housing
chapters.headline: Most of the new condos being built in Toronto are luxury and come with hefty fees

chapters.summary: Toronto has a missing middle problem. Cities like Portland have tried to take concrete steps to fix it. Camille Trummer worked with the mayor of Portland to pass zoning reform. While zoning reform isn't a silver bullet for a housing crisis, it is a big first step.
chapters.gist: Portland's Struggle for a Missing Middle
chapters.headline: Other cities with a missing middle have taken concrete steps to fix it

chapters.summary: Jay Coburn talks about one of the most insane examples of Toronto city planning. There's a 17 unit apartment building in the Forest Hill neighborhood that the city insists is actually just two semidetached houses. This is part of why a lot of the city is actually getting less dense.
chapters.gist: Toronto's insane plan to turn an apartment building into two houses
chapters.headline: Jay Coburn talks about controversial changes to Toronto zoning laws

chapters.summary: A combination of Byzantine municipal nonsense and economics means there are 17 potential units just sitting empty in Forest Hill. It's just another reminder that the incentives are all pushing the wrong behavior in people. Now buckle up, crank those tunes and ride with us in the California Road Trip Republic.
chapters.gist: 99% Invisible: The Problem With Urban Inclusion
chapters.headline: There are 17 potential units sitting empty in Forest Hill because of Byzantine municipal bureaucracy
